questions.question_text: A developer wants to be able to run a virtual machine on a desktop for application testing. Which of the following should a technician implement to complete this request?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
yes: D ! 
A type 2 hypervisor, also called a hosted hypervisor, runs on top of a conventional operating system as a software layer or application. This abstracts the guest operating systems from the host operating system.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should be considered FIRST when upgrading the power supply on a high-end gaming PC?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is for sure

questions.question_text: Which of the following allows several VMs to run on a single host?

discussion.content:
Isn't it Hypervisor?
A hypervisor allows one host computer to support multiple guest VMs by virtually sharing its resources, such as memory and processing.

questions.question_text: A user is having difficulty using a personal all-in-one printer. When the user scans a single-page document in flatbed mode, the scan appears correctly; however, when using the printer's document feeder, the scan has a vertical line going across the page. Which of the following should a technician perform FIRST to resolve this issue?

choices.B: Install a pickup roller replacement kit.
choices.D: Use a microfiber cloth to clean the glass.

comments.content: Thought to be fair... It says which one would you do first. And cleaning is always first vs replacing... Normally you would clean the pick up rollers first. In this case i can see why you would say separation bad because of "First".

I would actually go with the pickup roller. Pick up rollers are part of maintenance kits. The pick up roller will transfer the paper and is interacting with the paper more to the point where if there is dirt/toner/ink somewhere on the roller it can leave a mark on the paper in a consistent place. The pick up rollers are also referred to at times as the Document Feed rollers which this question addresses.

discussion.content: So you would "Install" before you "clean" ?? Really ?

Selected Answer: B
Pick up rollers are part of maintenance kits. The pick up roller will transfer the paper and is interacting with the paper more to the point where if there is dirt/toner/ink somewhere on the roller it can leave a mark on the paper in a consistent place
It is asking for what to do FIRST, so the least intrusive option is cleaning the glass... if it doesn't work maybe time to replace the pickup roller.

Two glasses are used in scanning, 1: Flatbed glass and 2: ADF glass. The first is used during scans a single-page and the second during scanning from ADF. The answer is D but Comptia+ should identify between the two glasses. Refer to https://support.hp.com/ee-en/product/hp-color-laserjet-pro-mfp-m477-series/7326560/document/c06432233

comments.content: Raid 5 needs at least 3 disks...but It can have 4. He wants the maximum amount of size so using the fourth disk makes sense.

Raid 5 requires 3 disks to set up, right? How will the 'extra' disk it leaves you with provide extra storage and redundancy? 
I am no expert, but my reasoning tells me it will provide extra storage without redundancy which does not serve the purpose.
I would go RAID 10

Definitely Raid 5. With raid 10 you will lose effectively 50% of your Storage. Raid 5 will give you fault tolerance through parity and you only sacrifice 1 disk worth of storage rather than 50% like Raid 10. In this case you will be able to use the equivalent of 3 disks for storage with Raid 5.

discussion.content: Should the answer not be RAID 5 since the customer wants the highest possible capacity but still able to survive loss of a drive. RAID 10 would reduce capacity to 2 drives. RAID 5 you would still get to use all 4 drives you would just use some space for parity blocks

Selected Answer: C
To achieve the highest capacity possible while maintaining redundancy and the ability to survive a drive failure, the technician should configure RAID 5.

Selected Answer: C
RAID 5 has more capacity than RAID 10.

Selected Answer: C
I would go with RAID 5

lets say all four harddrives capacity is 1TB

if we applied

RAID 0 : No Fault tolerance. 
RAID 1 : "There should be exactly two drives in RAID1 (Mirror)"
RAID 5 : Capacity (3 TB) / Fault tolerance(1-drive failure)
RAID 10 :Capacity (2 TB) / Fault tolerance(At least 1-drive failure)

http://www.raid-calculator.com/

comments.content: RAID 5 makes more sense based on this info, the customer is okay with "a (1) hard drive failure" with the highest capacity

questions.question_text: A technician needs to configure a high-end workstation with four hard drives for redundancy. The customer wants the end result to have the highest capacity possible but still have the ability to survive a drive failure. Which of the following RAID levels should the technician configure to accomplish this?
